Students do better when they have nutritious meals that help them learn & grow, & often school is the only place where they can access healthy options. They don’t need more junk food. I'll do all I can to fight this proposed rollback of nutrition standards https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2020/01/17/usda-proposes-changing-school-menus-allow-more-fries-pizza-fewer-vegetables-fruits-reversing-michelle-obama-effort/ …

I’m heartbroken by what I saw today. This is no way to treat families who are coming to the U.S. seeking a better life. The #RemainInMexico policy must end. We need to open our arms, hearts, and country. #DemsAtTheBorder #DontLookAway pic.twitter.com/qKlvgRjmIU

This is a large refugee camp, without the resources and support it needs — all because of Trump’s #RemainInMexico policy. It is inexcusable. We must do all we can to make sure these families are safe. #SaveAsylum #DemsAtTheBorder pic.twitter.com/MNlFv54xbr
We cannot look away from what is happening at our border. #DontLookAway #DemsAtTheBorder pic.twitter.com/K4a5g7tBCn

One of the first things I noticed in Matamoros was how many children are here at the refugee camp. It is unbelievable. The scale of the camp and conditions are heartbreaking. pic.twitter.com/9OqxbaoI6E
I spoke with Angry Tias and Abuelas (@AngryTiasRGV) about the work they are doing to help those who are waiting at the border. #FamiliesAtTheBorder #DemsAtTheBorder pic.twitter.com/cFQz6tI08b
I’m extremely concerned about the conditions asylum seekers are staying in and how long they have to wait to make their case. #DontLookAway #DemsAtTheBorder pic.twitter.com/rA9aXAjvAl

Crossing the border to Matamoros, Mexico, where families are being sent to stay in dangerous conditions while seeking asylum under the Trump admin’s #RemainInMexico policy. #DemsAtTheBorder pic.twitter.com/g7y9PE15Yi

Last night I arrived in Texas w/ my @HispanicCaucus colleagues for an important trip to investigate the Trump administration’s harmful #RemainInMexico policy. We’ll be observing conditions for asylum seekers on both sides of the border today. Follow along here. #DemsAtTheBorder pic.twitter.com/IG2DT49n84

Everyone on Earth benefits from a healthy ocean & stable cryosphere, our planet's frozen system. Together they regulate the global exchange of water, energy & carbon. In the #ClimateCrisis, we must implement ocean-centric solutions & decrease human-caused greenhouse gas emissions pic.twitter.com/d19TfiCgEO

I joined @chelliepingree & @RepNewhouse to introduce a common sense, bipartisan bill that will provide funding and resources for schools to tackle food waste. It will help address the #ClimateCrisis and empower students to participate in this process. https://bonamici.house.gov/media/press-releases/bonamici-pingree-newhouse-introduce-bipartisan-bill-prevent-food-waste-nation-s …

The U.S. Senate passed the #USMCA agreement, which I helped negotiate. This is how it will help bring more certainty to businesses and workers in Oregon: https://www.opb.org/news/article/oregon-business-north-american-trade-deal-us-mexico-canada-agreement-support/ …

Today the House took a stand for students and voted to block the Trump administration’s harmful new rule. https://bonamici.house.gov/media/press-releases/bonamici-votes-block-devos-rule-hurts-defrauded-students …
According to the Department’s own estimate, only about 3 percent of the loan debt held by defrauded borrowers would be dismissed under the new rule. That is not justice.
The original Borrower Defense rule allowed debt forgiveness. Unfortunately, Sec. DeVos rewrote the rule to make it nearly impossible for future students who are victimized to receive relief.
Students who are defrauded by predatory, for-profit institutions should not be stuck with student loan debt. pic.twitter.com/R9jVCnnyi2

Tomorrow the House will take a powerful stand against Sec. DeVos’ attempts to put unscrupulous for-profit institutions ahead of defrauded students. Learn more about this important vote here: https://www.newsweek.com/betsy-devos-borrower-defense-student-loan-forgiveness-house-vote-1482148 …

Today the House passed legislation I helped lead, the Protecting Older Workers Against Age Discrimination Act, to restore protections against age discrimination. We must make our laws clear – unlawful discrimination in the workplace is unacceptable  https://bonamici.house.gov/media/press-releases/house-passes-bipartisan-bonamici-bill-protect-older-workers-age-discrimination … #POWADA

Oregon has a rapidly aging population. My office has helped older workers who have filed age discrimination complaints at the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission, but the burden and the outcomes are uncertain. pic.twitter.com/HjrExBqzrJ

The facts are abundantly clear: President Trump has abused the power of his office and obstructed Congress. The House fulfilled its Constitutional duty and now the Senate must do the same. https://www.opb.org/news/article/npr-house-set-to-vote-to-send-trump-impeachment-articles-to-senate/ …

This morning I spoke with @cspanwsj about legislation I’m leading to protect older workers from discrimination. The House will vote on this important bill tomorrow.  https://www.c-span.org/video/?468099-5/washington-journal-suzanne-bonamici-discusses-older-americans-job-discrimination …

I’m pleased that @edlaborcmte approved a bipartisan update to the Runaway and Homeless Youth Act. It will expand and improve services for homeless youth, strengthen investments in critical programs, protect youth from discrimination, and more.

Millions of youth across the country, including in my home state of Oregon, do not have access to a stable home. If these young people receive the services they need to transition out of homelessness, they can thrive as self-sufficient individuals. pic.twitter.com/oxJ1T9CDcB
I'm a proud supporter of #HR1, which the House passed to level the playing field for everyday Americans, shine a light on dark money, & more.

It has been 10 years since the disastrous #CitizensUnited decision opened the floodgates to money in politics & highlighted the need for campaign finance reform. https://twitter.com/HouseDemocrats/status/1217138070840991744 …

Today the @EdLaborCmte approved legislation I helped lead to make sure pregnant workers get the reasonable accommodations they need to protect their health and maintain their job. 
 https://bonamici.house.gov/media/press-releases/bonamici-backed-bill-protect-pregnant-workers-discrimination-advances-house … #LongOverdue

As a mom and a policymaker, I know how important it is for pregnant workers to be able to work and stay healthy during pregnancy. But 3 out of 5 pregnant workers have experienced discrimination on the job. pic.twitter.com/IXK4rSKX1u
I’m just about to go on @cspanwj to talk about protecting older workers from discrimination. Tune in here:  https://www.c-span.org/series/?washingtonJournal … pic.twitter.com/09uUlgHKEZ

Happy golden anniversary, @NOAA! For nearly 50 years, NOAA scientists have advanced our understanding of the ocean & atmosphere. I look forward to continuing to work with you on @HouseScience & as Co-Chair of the House Oceans Caucus to address the #ClimateCrisis & #DefendScience.

I recently joined the Congressional Taiwan Caucus to support the strong ties between our two countries. I congratulate Taiwan on another successful democratic election. #TaiwanElections https://twitter.com/houseforeign/status/1216741297366753280 …

Our bill will strengthen blue carbon research and support the conservation & restoration of blue carbon ecosystems. Learn more here: https://bonamici.house.gov/media/press-releases/bonamici-posey-beyer-mast-introduce-bipartisan-bill-advance-blue-carbon-protect …

Blue carbon refers to the powerful ability of coastal ecosystems to sequester carbon dioxide from the atmosphere and store it for centuries to millennia in plant matter and soils. It is an opportunity to use a natural tool in our fight against the #ClimateCrisis.

The unprecedented scale of the climate crisis requires that we act immediately, and our ocean & coastal ecosystems can be part of the solution. I’m grateful to @congbillposey, @repdonbeyer, & @RepBrianMast for joining me to introduce the bipartisan Blue Carbon for Our Planet Act. pic.twitter.com/cZbW0TNo3d
Tomorrow @EdLaborCmte will be considering bipartisan legislation I’ve championed to finally #ProtectPregnantWorkers from discrimination. Tune in here: https://youtu.be/4tVv454qqx0

It is unacceptable that women still have to choose between a safe pregnancy and a paycheck. Thank you to @CBSThisMorning
for highlighting the stories of strong women who are fighting workplace discrimination & what we are doing on @EdLaborCmte to help them https://www.cbsnews.com/news/fighting-for-overdue-protections-for-pregnant-workers-pregnant-workers-fairness-act/ …

NW Oregon is home to the pristine Oregon Coast, abundant forests, a flourishing wine country, and so much more. I spoke to @REI about urgent conservation & stewardship issues like the #ClimateCrisis and attempts to sell or transfer public lands. https://www.rei.com/blog/news/representing-the-outdoors-representative-suzanne-bonamici …

PFAS chemicals are contaminating our air, land, & water and are linked with adverse health effects. @EPA is failing to protect our communities from PFAS, but today the House passed the bipartisan #PFAS Action Act to regulate PFAS, clean up contamination, & protect public health.
I will continue to do all I can to prevent a war with Iran and to exert the oversight of Congress in this serious matter.

War should be a last resort, waged only under the rarest of circumstances when our national security is in direct jeopardy and no other option is available. The sparse evidence presented by the Trump administration to justify its actions has not met that standard.

Passing a War Powers Resolution today was a clear stand – backed by the powers the Constitution granted to Congress – against President Trump’s reckless decisions that escalated tensions with Iran, endangered our troops, and risked dragging us into another war.
Congress has an important role in maintaining our country’s security. https://bonamici.house.gov/media/press-releases/bonamici-joins-house-affirming-authority-congress-limit-military-action-against …

My recommendations for President Trump include "The Uninhabitable Earth," "Designing Climate Solutions," and “Drawdown." Even better, he could read his own administration’s #NCA4. https://twitter.com/LFFriedman/status/1215324941932953605 …

Supporting diversity should be a priority for all types of organizations, not just in sports. I’m encouraged that the law to implement the Rooney Rule, which was my bill in the state legislature, has had a positive influence on hiring practices. https://theundefeated.com/features/oregon-law-on-hiring-minority-college-coaches-works-so-why-isnt-it-used-elsewhere/ …

These proposed regulations to roll back #NEPA will help the fossil fuel industry, not our planet. https://twitter.com/nytimes/status/1215276501983277057 …

I'm glad we passed several #5G bills today to affirm and advance U.S. leadership on this cutting-edge technology. Our national strategy moving forward must build on the steps taken today by incorporating community input and respecting the needs & rights of our local partners.

Marine labs like @HatfieldMSC support important research on ocean acidification, hypoxia, sea level rise, and other effects of the #ClimateCrisis on our ocean & coastal ecosystems. #OceanClimateAction must include robust investments in marine science. https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/07/climate/climate-change-marine-science.html …

It has been 9 years since @GabbyGiffords and 18 others were shot in Tucson. Since that day, she has been fighting for meaningful gun violence prevention reforms to protect us all. Today and every day, I stand with her in that effort. #EnoughIsEnough

Tomorrow I will attend a classified briefing about the situation, where I hope to get answers to the many valid questions and concerns about the President’s increasingly confrontational approach with Iran.
For the safety of our troops and the security of our country, I strongly support efforts to deescalate this situation before it spirals further out of control.
I am closely monitoring the reports of attacks by Iran targeting our soldiers in Iraq. My thoughts are with those in the area and their families.

Our community is stronger because of her dedication to inclusivity and the thoughtful service she provides to students with disabilities and their families. https://www.opb.org/news/article/special-education-oregon-teacher-of-the-year-mercedes-munoz/ …

A great strength of the United States is the ability to show restraint when provoked. I urge the President to stop escalating this confrontation with Iran and avoid starting another futile war that Congress has not authorized.

The President and his national security team have not articulated a long-term strategy. They have neither justified the risky and inflammatory action they have already taken nor demonstrated that they are pursuing the best course of action to keep our troops and our country safe.

The events in Iraq over the past few days are deeply troubling. The Trump administration must present its rationale for recent military actions to Congress, a co-equal branch that directly represents the American people.
But most importantly, Nick loved his family. I hope Patricia, the children, and the extended family are comforted by memories of happy times together with this remarkable man.  Rest in peace, Nick.

He was a strong advocate for the arts, and I’ll always remember when he joined me for a tour of the Portland Art Museum with the Chair of the National Endowment for the Arts. Nick occasionally entertained me with stories about his time working with former Congressman Barney Frank pic.twitter.com/k4l4aETV3T

Although he came from a long line of prominent New York politicians, Nick was truly humble. He worked hard and was passionate about our community, especially on issues of housing and homelessness, the environment, and parks.
I’m devastated to hear about the death of Portland Commissioner Nick Fish. Nick was one of the kindest and most authentic people I’ve known.

According to #NCA4, sea level rise may force 13.1 million people to migrate by 2100. In Oregon, coastal communities are struggling to forecast variability in sea level rise.
